showScoreExcerpt:
"Craig identifies a core of thuggery in Macbeth — he’s a lunkish, perhaps even dimwitted soldier of fortune who quickly gets drunk on ambition and power, until he’s literally an axe-wielding maniac. Associations with a certain Russian despot, especially in Craig’s steely, blue-eyed stare and ramrod posture, seem very much intentional."
